reviews.text: and having a starbuck....= good times
reviews.title: Below average for this hotel chain

reviews.text: This Hyatt is the epitome of an "average" hotel, so the name of the game is to get a great rate or go elsewhere. If this hotel had a flavor - it'd be a cross between vanilla, white bread and wet cardboard. The amenities, staff, rooms, gym - all average. There's absolutely nothing that stands out. It's just a place to sleep.
reviews.title: Was very pleased with my stay

reviews.text: We were supposed to stay at the Hyatt 2 nights, but checked out after one night. Our room was not ready upon check in and we never got a call when our room was ready. When we got to the room I had to call the front desk and ask what the noise was. We were told that they were doing some work from 9-5. We were not informed about that before checking in. Also, the pool had a lot of hair floating in it. When we were asked about our stay, I told the front desk that we were not informed about the repairs going on or notified when our room was ready. She did not offer an apology but she did say "Oh". Why bother asking how our stay was? The comments from the front desk are standard script. Not what we expected from Hyatt. While the room was comfortable and the view was nice, you had to pay for internet access.
reviews.title: Not the best in customer service

reviews.text: would not stay here again the way we were treated made us feel not welcome from the time we checked in there was an indian wedding taking place and thats all the staff cared about we paid alot of money to stay here.the rooms needed upgrading and the pool was a joke we couldent put our toe in it was that full.
reviews.title: not a nice a it looks

reviews.text: My husband had to go to LB for business for a few days so baby and I decided to tag along. We're both pretty well travelled but it was our first trip with a baby....
reviews.title: so-so - on the fence about return visit...

reviews.text: My husband was there on business so I'm not sure what the price would have been if we'd been paying for the room as a family trip. I think that there's a pretty good price with the AAA card that includes the breakfast buffet ...
reviews.title: Terrific Hotel Overall

reviews.text: We had requested a crib when we booked and again when we checked in - the woman at the counter told us that the crib would be in room before we got there. That didn't hapen and it def. felt like housekeeping took their time to be sure that we'd tip them. The "crib" was a "pack and play" - again, this our first time travelling with baby so maybe that's "standard" (?) but I really expected an actual "crib".
reviews.title: Clean, Friendly and expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was a good choice if you are a business traveller as it is very close to the convention center. Me and my wife were just there to experience and check out the Long Beach area. There are a lot of business hotels around the area and I am not sure if these hotel just caters to business travellers as they lack the aura of relaxation when you enter the property. Our room is a bit tight and the view is not so good as the previous Hyatt we checked in at Mission Bay. Overall, this hotel is good but not that great.
reviews.title: Best Hotel for Business Travellers Not For Vacationers

reviews.text: The Hyatt Regency in Long Beach, CA was centrally located and to site see in the LA area. We had a room with a beautiful harbor view. We chose this hotel through Continental because of the price range and location.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: We arrived late and granted the hotel is going through some renovations but the whole place just lacked the feel of a stylish hotel. The front desk staff were short in conversation and rather blunt. Our room had just been painted and after 30min you became use to the smell or high! The view is amazing of the Harbour and can see the The Queen Mary. Parking was $17 per night self park or $25 valet. Overall bed was confortable but hotel just lacked the X factor!
reviews.title: The Hyatt was OK but the hotel lacked atmosphere!

reviews.text: After reading the reviews on Tripadvisor I was concerned about staying at the Hyatt but I was attending a conference for five days at the convention center and since the hotel is connected to the convention center by a walkway I decided to give it a try. I am glad that I did. The employees at the hotel went out of their way to assist us. Everyone from the registration personnel, the restaurant staff to the housekeeping staff were both efficient and friendly. Our room was large, well stocked and very clean. Our room overlooked the marina and the ocean. The housekeeping personnel went out of their way to help us. Every morning we had breakfast in the room and it excellent. A little expensive but again you are in a hotel. Dinners in the hotel restaurant were very good. The hotel is in the middle of everything. It is situated next to the convention center and a stones throw away from the marina area. It is within walking distance to the Aquarium of the Pacific and some great restaurants. When In Long Beach again I would definately stay at the Hyatt. A special thank you to registration manager Kyle Sprague who did an excellent job in making our stay enjoyable.
reviews.title: Great Hotel With a Wonderful Staff

reviews.text: My friends & I attended the Long Beach Quilt Show which was held at the Convention Center. The hotel is located within easy walking distance to the Center, Pier and resturants. Our room was clean, beds & pillows were comfortable. The harbour view lovely. For dining, we ate at nearby resturants and found a breakfast place nearby. Upside about this place, is it's location, view and the in-house Starbucks. Sharing the room with a friend made the stay affordable.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good location for attractions, restaurants and bars. Pool lovely and staff really helpful. Near to main freeways so the rest of Los Angeles accessible. All in all, a great stay.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hyatt because it’s connected to the Long Beach Convention Center, where I was attending a conference. However, it is not a business-friendly hotel. I had to pay for wi-fi, and pretty high rates at that. And you have to pay for internet time, computer time, and printing per page in the “business center”! Outrageous! I’ve never been so nickeled and dimed! The room was certainly nothing special. A little worn, a little small, not special amenities, yet it charged like a luxury hotel. Checkout is 10AM if you aren’t a Hyatt club member, which is fairly inconvenient if you have a later flight after a conference. The only good thing I can say is maybe it’s an OK place for a wedding or a family trip (although, why would you vacation in Long Beach?). The view of the waterfront was nice, but not worth nearly $300 a night – and that was the “conference” rate!
reviews.title: Definitely not a business hotel
mixed stay
reviews.text: I stayed in this Long Beach Hyatt because of its proximity to the Long Beach Marina. Hotel was Ok, nothing special, but what was annoying was the difficulty with the card key system. Card codes seem to last a couple of hours at best. same for my wife. with long lines at the registration it became a big hassle..sometimes they'd just tell us to wait by our room for someone to come up, which then didn't happen. Stayed at many hotels since without a card key issue!

Hyatt Long Beach is an excellent Hyatt. It is right across from the waterfront, surrounded on 2 sides by 3 shopping centers, many restaurents and entertainment sites. Immediately next door to the convention center within 2-3 minutes walk. The hotel itself is big, bright and clean. Rooms are large with full view of the ocean, waterfront malls, harbour, sailing ships, light house, bridge, Queen Mary, floating islands, sunset and distant mountains. The only regret is the window is waist-high, you have to stand to see the view. Elevator is fast and not crowded. Sometimes there are a lot of people but never felt crowded and never noisy.
reviews.title: Excellent Hyatt, best Hyatt club lounge

reviews.text: Hotel is 2 blocks from a part of Long Beach with many more restaurants and shops, which are always packed with hundreds sitting at the sidewalk tables. The shops seem more lower range of stores. It is also within 10-20 minutes driving to nearby small towns along the coast with even more shops and restauranrts.
reviews.title: Great location, usually excellent service, but cutting corners

aka: Hyatt Regency Long Beach Hotel Long Beach
description: Full service hotel with water views from rooms. Walking distance to 100 shops and restaurants, Aquarium of the Pacific. Centrally located for easy travel to Southern California attractions (Disneyland, Knotts Berry Farm, Universal Studios).
